channel.title: Matrix Kernels - Domain Flow Architecture
channel.description: Matrix Kernels are important to characterize and classify the underlying system of equations. Identifying singularity, and quantifying the null-space of a matrix are key operators before we can try to solve systems of equations.

item.title: Matrix Kernels
item.description: In mathematics, the kernel of a linear map, also known as the null space or nullspace, is the linear subspace of the domain of the map which is mapped to the zero vector. That is, given a linear map $$L : V \rightarrow W$$ between two vector spaces $V$ and $W$, the kernel of $L$ is the vector space of all elements $v$ of $V$ such that $L(v) = 0$, where 0 denotes the zero vector in $W, or more symbolically:
